results.title: Learning about leaves
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William M. Harlow
results.brief_description: How leaves are important to plants, animals and humans. Different kids of leaves; how leaves are related to other parts of the plant; the functions of green leaves; the changes that take place through the seasons. Uses time-lapse photography, animation and close-ups.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William M. Harlow

results.title: Learning about flowers and their seeds. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Uses time-lapse photography and animation to illustrate the biological functions of flowers and their seeds, the reproduction cycle, from seed to plant, to flower and back to seed. Demonstrates their contribution to the food supply.

results.title: Learning about flowers
results.brief_description: An instructional film for primary classes explaining that the main function of flowers is to produce seeds. Identifies some common varieties of flowers including the morning glory, goatsbeard tulip, pussy willow and dogwood. Observes by use of close up time-lapse photography the stages in the growth of a bud, and in the growth of fruits from flowers.

results.title: Learning about air
results.creator_credit: ACI Films, Stelios Roccos and Peter Scheer
results.brief_description: Introduces basic scientific properties of air using simple examples. Shows that air has weight, occupies space and can exert pressure; explains that a combination of a force with air can create energy as in the powering of a windmill. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACI Films, Stelios Roccos and Peter Scheer

results.title: Learning
results.brief_description: Summary: Shows experiments in learning. B.F. Skinner, Richard Malott deal with operant conditioning. Nathan Azrin demonstrates aversive conditioning. Jack Hailman deals with sign stimuli. G.P. Baerends demonstrates super normal conditioning and explains t

results.title: Learn to swim. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, New Zealand. Dept. of Education, Robert Steele and Ronald Bowie
results.brief_description: Presented in 3 parts. Part 1 deals with the gaining of confidence and getting used to being in water. Part 2 focuses on general excersises such as foot and leg action whereas part 3 deals entirely with arm action.

results.title: Learn to ski
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description: In skiing, the beginner is wise to learn the right technique at the outset so that he has nothing to unlearn. This film shows the best techniques, as recommended by the Canadian Ski Instructors’ Alliance and the Canadian Amateur Ski Association. Every movement is clearly demonstrated in action and, where necessary, in slow-motion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Ernest Reid
